l7:ResourceSet.l7:Resource: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <wsp:Policy xmlns:L7p="http://www.layer7tech.com/ws/policy" xmlns:wsp="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2002/12/policy"> <wsp:All wsp:Usage="Required"> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="**********************************************"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <wsp:All wsp:Usage="Required"> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="This policy gets executed whenever an OTK Cache * assertion is used."/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="This policy can be modified in order to set default configuration values for caches that are introduced."/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="For each cache follow the example shown below:"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="- Add an 'All assertions must evaluate to true' assertion"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="- Check for the cacheID (name) and set values appropriately"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="**"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="***** OTK Cache Look Up Customization *****"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Customizable hook for cache lookup. This is used by OTK Cache Handler as a policy fragment"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Available context variables:"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** cacheID (String) - the ID of the cache to be stored"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** cacheKey - the key associated with the value to be looked up"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** maxEntryAge - the max age in seconds for entries into this cache"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="**"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="***** OTK Cache Store Customization *****"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Customizable hook for cache store. This is used by OTK Cache Handler as a policy fragment, and is called for REMOVE, STORE and FLUSH operations"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Available context variables:"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** cacheID (String) - the ID of the cache to be stored"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** cacheKey - the key associated with the given value for the cache identified by cacheID"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** maxEntries - the maximum number of entries allowed in the cache. Adding more than this limit would force some existing items to be removed."/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** maxEntryAge - the max age in seconds for entries into this cache"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** maxEntrySize - the maximum size in bytes allowable for the value"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="**********************************************"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** NOTE: only one maxEntryAge, maxEntrySize and maxEntries value is supported per cacheID "/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Changing any of these values after the cache has been created will result in the cache configuration being updated."/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> </wsp:All> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="**********************************************"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <wsp:OneOrMore L7p:Enabled="false" wsp:Usage="Required"> <wsp:All wsp:Usage="Required"> <L7p:ComparisonAssertion> <L7p:CaseSensitive booleanValue="false"/> <L7p:Expression1 stringValue="${cacheID}"/> <L7p:Expression2 stringValue="myCache"/> <L7p:Predicates predicates="included"> <L7p:item binary="included"> <L7p:CaseSensitive booleanValue="false"/> <L7p:RightValue stringValue="myCache"/> </L7p:item> </L7p:Predicates> </L7p:ComparisonAssertion> <wsp:OneOrMore wsp:Usage="Required"> <L7p:ComparisonAssertion> <L7p:CaseSensitive booleanValue="false"/> <L7p:Expression1 stringValue="${maxEntryAge}"/> <L7p:Expression2 stringValue=""/> <L7p:Negate booleanValue="true"/> <L7p:Operator <L7p:entry> <L7p:key stringValue="LEFT.COMMENT"/> <L7p:value stringValue="new"/> </L7p:entry> <L7p:entry> <L7p:key stringValue="RIGHT.COMMENT"/> <L7p:value stringValue="// configure the new lifetime"/> </L7p:entry> </L7p:Properties> </L7p:AssertionComment> <L7p:Base64Expression stringValue="MTIwMA=="/> <L7p:VariableToSet stringValue="maxEntryAge"/> </L7p:SetVariable> <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <wsp:Policy xmlns:L7p="http://www.layer7tech.com/ws/policy" xmlns:wsp="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2002/12/policy"> <wsp:All wsp:Usage="Required"> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="***** OTK Cache Look Up Customization *****"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Available context variables:"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** cacheID (String) - the ID of the cache to be stored"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** cacheKey - the key associated with the value to be looked up"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** maxEntryAge - the max age that the cache was originally created with"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="**"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Must return: the variable 'resp' as a Message for found content"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Must fail if the looked up value does not exist!"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="**"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Replace the assertion below if desired with an assertion that supports key- value data structures"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** If this assertion is replaced also replace it at 'OTK Cache Store Customization'"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CacheLookup> <L7p:CacheEntryKey stringValue="${cacheKey}"/> <L7p:CacheId stringValue="${actualCacheID}"/> <L7p:ContentTypeOverride stringValue=""/> <L7p:MaxEntryAgeSeconds stringValue="${maxEntryAge}"/> <L7p:OtherTargetMessageVariable stringValue="resp"/> <L7p:Target target="OTHER"/> </L7p:CacheLookup> </wsp:All> </wsp:Policy>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <wsp:Policy xmlns:L7p="http://www.layer7tech.com/ws/policy" xmlns:wsp="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2002/12/policy"> <wsp:All wsp:Usage="Required"> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="***** OTK Cache Store Customization *****"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="**********************************************"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Available context variables:"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** cacheID (String) - the ID of the cache to be stored"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** cacheKey - the key associated with the given value for the cache identified by cacheID"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** maxEntries - the maximum number of entries allowed in the cache. Adding more than this limit would force some existing items to be removed."/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** maxEntryAge - the maximum length (seconds) to keep entries in the cache. "/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** maxEntrySize - the maximum size in bytes allowable for the value"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="**"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** Replace the assertion below if desired with an assertion that support key- value data structures"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:Comment stringValue="** If this assertion is replaced also replace it at 'OTK Cache Look Up Customization'"/> </L7p:CommentAssertion> <L7p:CacheStorage> <L7p:CacheEntryKey stringValue="${cacheKey}"/> <L7p:CacheId stringValue="${actualCacheID}"/> <L7p:MaxEntries stringValue="${maxEntries}"/> <L7p:MaxEntryAgeSeconds stringValue="${maxEntryAge}"/> <L7p:MaxEntrySizeBytes stringValue="${maxEntrySize}"/> <L7p:OtherTargetMessageVariable stringValue="msg"/> <L7p:Target target="OTHER"/> </L7p:CacheStorage> </wsp:All> </wsp:Policy>

l7:EncapsulatedAssertionArgument.l7:GuiLabel: The Cache Key (identifier) for this entry (required)
Max. number of entries for this cache (optional if a default value exists)
Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)
Max. size for each entry (optional if a default value exists)
The message to be cached (required, must exist in the preceeding policy context)

l7:Property.l7:StringValue: Writes an item to cache with ID: cacheID with key: cacheKey. If the cache does not exist, one will be created. If the key exists, the existing item will be overwritten.

l7:Property.l7:StringValue: Finds the OAuth 2.0 access_token within the http request header, as http request parameter or uses the given one. If will fail if a token is found at multiple locations.

l7:Property.l7:StringValue: This assertion returns an error message, http status and content-type value associated with the given 'Error code'.

A value combined with the given error code. If, for example, an API would be identifiedby the values '1234' and the given error code is '111' the exported variable 'error.code' would contain '1234111'
A value associated with a certain error. If that value is unkown it will be replaced with '000' within the output variable 'error.code'

l7:EncapsulatedAssertionArgument.l7:GuiLabel: Fail if this SCOPE was granted?

l7:Property.l7:StringValue: Validates an OAuth 2.0 access_token for a request. By default the request will fail if the given access_token has expired or does not match the given configuration.
Time in seconds for which the access_token will not be validated again. Use this value as a compromise between increasing performance and security. A typical value would be '30'
Use this field if no access_token is received through the request message but was issued out-of-band
If set to 'true' the access_token (and the associated refresh_token) will be invalidated after being used once. Default = 'false'
If set to 'true' the assertion fails if the given SCOPE was granted for this access_token
A space separated list of SCOPE values this access_token MUST have been granted for
The content-type of the 'error.msg' if it exists
The client_id for which the access_token was granted
A JSON structure containing the used grant_type, the client_type and values specified in the custom field of the associated client_id
The SCOPE that was granted to the access_token
The user who granted the access_token/ client

l7:Property.l7:StringValue:
Override the HTTP connection and read timeout.
The Connection Timeout defines the maximum time (in milliseconds) the Gateway attempts to establish a TCP connection. If exceeded, the routing will fail.
The Read Timeout defines the maximum time (in milliseconds) allowed for response data (not necessarily the complete response) to be read for the outbound request. If exceeded, the routing will fail.
